summary:
Christopher Columbus was an Italian explorer who sailed across the Atlantic Ocean for Spain. Between 1492 and 1504, he led four expeditions to the Caribbean, Central, and South America. Columbus was looking for a new way to Asia, but instead found what Europeans called the "New World."

His voyages started the Age of Discovery, leading to the colonization of the Americas and changing history. People now know the Americas as "America," named after Amerigo Vespucci, who realized it was a new continent.
title: Voyages of Christopher Columbus
